intro: Actinoseris stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, waxy leaves and produces yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open plains. Its botanical structure is adapted to withstand drought and intense sunlight, making it a hardy species in harsh climates.
